diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute perforated calculous cholecystitis, Klebsiella bacteremia, Atrial fibrillation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with abdominal CT findings showing a distended and perforated gallbladder along with a large gallstone at the gallbladder neck and small fluid collections surrounding it. Laboratory results indicated Klebsiella pneumoniae, supporting the diagnosis of bacteremia. The patient's history of hypertension and recent medication changes were also considered. No abdominal pain was reported despite the findings.
